intro: Calamintha alpina var. erecta, commonly known as alpine germander, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and slightly serrated, often with a fragrant aroma when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
